newsitem.title: USA: Former Senator Bill Bradley joins CBS News.
newsitem.headline: Former Senator Bill Bradley joins CBS News.

text.p: Former U.S. Sen. Bill Bradley will become a contributor to CBS News, CBS officials announced Tuesday.

Bradley, who retired from the Senate last year after three terms, will appear primarily on the CBS Evening News weekend editions as well as other CBS News broadcasts, Andrew Heyward, president of CBS News, said.

"I am excited about the chance to comment on America today -- what are our changing circumstances, what brings out the best in us, what stories give our lives meaning," Bradley said in a statement. The 53-year-old Democrat was first elected to the Senate from New Jersey in 1978.

A Rhodes Scholar from Princeton University, he was captain of the gold-medal winning U.S. basketball team in the 1964 Tokyo Olympics and played professional basketball with the New York Knicks from 1967 to 1977 as the team's starting forward, winning two NBA championships.
He also has written three books including "Time Present, Time Past," a 1996 memoir about his travels and life in the Senate.

Since leaving the Senate, he has served as chairman of the National Civic League, Distinguished Leadership Scholar at the University of Maryland and Payne Distinguished Professor at the Institute of International Studies at Stanford University.
